title: Panel, 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: warp resist dyed before weaving (jaspe); warp-faced plain weave
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 223 x 13 cm (7 ft. 3 13/16 in. x 5 1/8 in.)
description: Plain stripes of red, yellow, ivory silk and tan cotton separating three stripes of ikat in two shades of blue on ivory cotton with plants, birds, geometric shapes and dashes. The warp is knotted at each end with added fringe attached. Selvage on one side only. Probably cut from a shawl.

tombstone.epitaph:
Panel, 20th century. Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: warp resist dyed before weaving (jaspe); warp-faced plain weave. 1966-86-1.
